title: aria-autocomplete attribute
description: Indicates whether inputting text could trigger display of one or more predictions of the user's intended value for an input and specifies how predictions would be presented if they are made.

assertions.title: convey the `inline` value
assertions.rationale: Screen reader users need to be aware that a form control has inline autocomplete behavior before they start typing so that the behavior is not unexpected.

Screen reader users need to be aware that a form control has list autocomplete behavior before they start typing so that the behavior is not unexpected. When used on a combobox, this value should hint to users that the popup contains auto complete suggestions rather than a static set of options.
assertions.title: convey the `list` value
convey the `both` value
assertions.rationale: Screen reader users need to be aware that a form control has both inline and list autocomplete behavior before they start typing so that the behavior is not unexpected. When used on a combobox, this value should hint to users that the popup contains auto complete suggestions rather than a static set of options.

assertions.title: convey the `none` value
assertions.rationale: Screen reader users should not be informed that auto complete behavior exists when the behavior does not exist.
examples: Screen readers will omit any announcements about autocomplete behavior.
